message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Primaquine targets the hypnozoite form of Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax, which are responsible for relapses in malaria. Trophozoite and schizont forms are targeted by chloroquine. Sporozoite is the infective form introduced into the human host by the Anopheles mosquito.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Primaquine is used to target Plasmodia hypnozoites, which are dormant stages of the parasite that can cause relapses in some types of malaria.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Primaquine targets the hypnozoite form of the Plasmodia parasite, which is responsible for relapses of malaria. Chloroquine, on the other hand, targets the trophozoite and schizont forms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Primaquine is used to target the hypnozoite form of Plasmodia, which remains dormant in liver cells and can cause relapses of an infection after the initial symptoms have been treated. Chloroquine is used to target the trophozoite and schizont forms of the parasite.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and peripheral blood smear are indicative of malaria caused by Plasmodium sp. The options are different stages of the plasmodium lifecycle. Hypnozoite is the inactive form of the parasite that can remain dormant in the liver and cause relapse months to years after the initial infection, and primaquine is effective against this form.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and peripheral blood smear findings suggest a Plasmodium infection. Chloroquine is used to target the trophozoite and schizont forms of the parasite, while primaquine targets the hypnozoite form. Therefore, the correct answer is (D) Hypnozoite.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Primaquine is used to target the hypnozoite form of Plasmodia, which is responsible for relapses of malaria. Chloroquine, on the other hand, targets the trophozoite and schizont forms of Plasmodia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Primaquine is used to treat Plasmodium vivax and Plasmodium ovale, which have a hypnozoite form. Chloroquine, on the other hand, targets the trophozoite and schizont forms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Primaquine targets hypnozoite forms of Plasmodia, which are found in the liver and can cause relapses later on. Chloroquine targets trophozoite and schizont forms of Plasmodia, which are found in the red blood cells.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Plasmodium vivax and Plasmodium ovale have dormant hypnozoite forms in the liver, and primaquine targets these forms. Chloroquine targets the erythrocytic forms of the parasite. Trophozoite and schizont forms are also targeted by different antimalarials.
